articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vancouver police said on Sunday said that a number of people had been killed and multiple others were injured after a driver drove into a crowd at street festival in the western Canadian city.
articles.title: Multiple dead after vehicle drives into crowd at Vancouver street festival, police say

articles.author: Matt Spetalnick, John Geddie, Lili Bayer
articles.description: He has launched an unprecedented global tariff war and slashed U.S. foreign aid. He has disparaged NATO allies and embraced Russia's narrative about its invasion of Ukraine. And he has spoken about annexing Greenland, retaking the Panama Canal and making Canada the 51st state.
articles.title: Trump's first 100 days: America First president is overturning the world order

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Steve Holland
articles.description: President Donald Trump and his administration this week will highlight the accomplishments of his first 100 days in office, while looking toward the next 100 days with a focus on trade deals and peace talks, White House officials said.
articles.title: Trump's next 100 days to feature trade deals, peace talks, 'torpedoes,' officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The death toll from a powerful explosion at Iran's biggest port of Bandar Abbas has risen to at least 25 dead, with more than 700 people injured, state media reported on Sunday, as firefighters worked to fully extinguish the fire.
articles.title: Death toll from blast at Iran's Bandar Abbas port rises to 25

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sheikh Mohammed said Hamas and Israel remained at odds over the ultimate goal of negotiations.
articles.title: Gaza ceasefire talks make some progress, Qatari PM says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on Sunday that a peace deal between Russia and Ukraine needs to happen soon, adding that the Trump administration will spend the coming week trying to determine whether to continue as a mediator.
articles.title: Rubio says Russia-Ukraine Peace deal needs to happen soon

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli army issued an evacuation order on Sunday for residents of a southern Beirut neighborhood, the first such warning in almost a month, in anticipation of a possible strike on what it says are Hezbollah targets - further testing a fragile ceasefire.
articles.title: Israel warns southern Beirut residents to evacuate ahead of possible strikes

articles.author: Giselda Vagnoni, Cristiano Corvino
articles.description: No pope had been laid to rest outside the Vatican in more than a century, but Francis opted instead for burial in Santa Maria Maggiore, located in the Italian capital's most multi-cultural neighbourhood.
articles.title: Thousands pack Rome church to visit Pope Francis' tomb

articles.author: Josh Smith
articles.description: Lee Jae-myung, the liberal South Korean politician favoured to become the country's next leader, has overcome a knife attack, martial law and criminal charges on his unexpected path back toward the presidency.
articles.title: South Korea martial law put Lee Jae-myung back on track for presidency

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ahmed Moallim Fiqi Ahmed, who previously served as foreign minister and national security chief, was appointed defense minister, replacing Jibril Abdirashid. The prime minister did not give a reason for the change.
articles.title: Somalia's prime minister appoints new defence minister in reshuffle
